p: More than 80% of infected patients experience mild symptoms and recover without intensive medical intervention. However, morbidity and mortality increase significantly with age, rising to 8.0% among patients 70-79 and 14.8% in patients over 80 in large-scale Chinese case reporting. Published case reports from the Chinese Centers for Disease Control indicate patients with underlying comorbid conditions have a heighted risk for contracting COVID-19 and a worse prognosis; depending on the report, between 25% and 50% of COVID-19 patients present with underlying conditions. Case fatality rates for comorbid patients are materially higher than the average population: Cancer: 5.6%, Hypertension: 6.0%, Chronic respiratory disease: 6.3%, Diabetes: 7.3% and CVD: 10.5% ( 21- 25).
